ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English turnep (late 15th century), probably a compound of turn (referring to its round shape) and obsolete neep (from Latin napus 'turnip').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A round root vegetable with white or cream-colored flesh and a green leafy top, often purple near the stem, grown for food.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种圆形根茎蔬菜，果肉呈白色或奶油色，顶部有绿色叶子，靠近茎部常呈紫色，可供食用。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She decided to make a hearty stew with carrots, potatoes, and turnips.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她决定用胡萝卜、土豆和芜菁做一份丰盛的炖菜。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: (Informal, derogatory) A foolish or stupid person.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Don't be such a turnip and try to understand what I'm explaining.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 别那么笨，试着理解我正在解释的东西。

REGISTER: General for the vegetable; informal and somewhat dated for the derogatory sense.
